subject: Nutrition
title: Portion vs Serving
description: A micro-lesson that makes Portion vs Serving usable.

hook.text: A serving of pasta is half a cup. Most restaurants give you four servings in one bowl.

buildup.text: A serving is a standardized amount on a label. A portion is how much you actually eat.

discovery.text: American portions have doubled since the 1970s. A bagel was 3 inches wide; now it's 6.

twist.text: Using smaller plates tricks your brain into feeling satisfied with lessâ€”the Delboeuf illusion.

climax.text: Learning the difference between a serving and a portion is one of the simplest paths to better eating.

punchline.text: Your plate lies about how much you need.

quiz.question: What is the Delboeuf illusion?
options: Food tastes better on white plates
Smaller plates make portions look bigger
